    SLDG - Introduction

    Semi-Lagrangian (SL) discontinuous Galerkin (DG) methods are a class of high-order deterministic transport solvers that enjoy advantages of both the SL approach and the DG spatial discretization.

    • high-order
    • deterministic transport solvers: è¿™ä¸ªæ˜¯æŒ‡ä½¿ç”¨ç¡®å®šçš„æ•°å€¼æ–¹æ³• (deterministric numerical methods) æ¥æ±‚è§£ä¼ è¾“æ–¹ç¨‹ (transprot equations), è€Œéæ˜¯ éšæœº / è’™ç‰¹å¡æ´›æ–¹æ³•ã€‚
      • Transport equations : æè¿°æ°”ä½“ï¼Œèƒ½é‡ï¼Œæˆ–ä¿¡æ¯åœ¨ç©ºé—´å°ºåº¦å’Œæ—¶é—´ä¸Šçš„ä¼ è¾“
    • The advantages of SL approach
    • The advantages of DG spatial discretization
    Krigo, Xiaofeng Caiå¤§çº¦ 4 åˆ†é’ŸCSComputer
    Direction

    Contents to be updated [1]

    1. Statistics
      1. Regression: OLS, GLM, logistic, and etc.
      2. Time-series : ARIMA, GARCH, ECM
      3. Nonparametric Regression: Splines, Kernel, Locally Weighted Regression
      4. Data exploration: Density, estimation, normality, tests, monte carlo copulas
      5. Data Cleaning and reduction: Cluster analysis, and stats theory
    2. Maths
      1. Cal, LA
      2. Optimization: talyor series, markov processes
      3. ODE, PDE
      4. Stochastic calculas: martingales, brownian motion, stochastic integrals, stochastic differential equations, Ito's Lemma, Feynman-Kac
      5. Binomial Asset
    3. CS
      1. Stats language: R, python, SAS ,matlab, SPSS,
      2. Programming language:python, c++
      3. memory management functions
      4. ML: Random forest, NN, Decision Tree, Clustering, Dimensionality reduction, ensemble
    4. Finance
      1. Equity: stock analysis, diversification,technical analysis, finance theory
      2. fixed income: rate curves, pricing duration, TVM
      3. derivatives: black scholes, BDT, stochastic volatility model, volatitlity sailes and theory
      4. portfolio optimization: CVaR, efficient frontier
      5. arbitrage theory and statistical, arbitrage
      6. risk management: VaR, statistics, credit risk, market risk, liquidity

    Anaconda
    1. å‘½ä»¤è¡Œè¾“é”™çš„æ—¶å€™ control+c ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œå°±å¯ä»¥é‡æ–°è¾“å…¥äº†
    Doriså°äº 1 åˆ†é’ŸCSComputer
    Anaconda

    1. Display all the environments

      conda env list

    2. Get the help for conda env

       conda env -h

    3. Release the space

      3.1 Delete useless packages

      conda clean -p

      3.2 Delete the .tar files

      conda clean -t

    4. Create a new environment

      conda create -n your_env_name python=x.x

    5. Clone an environment

      The new environment will be under the Anaconda installation path, normally under 'D:\Anaconda3\envs'

      I've tried this one, and it's OK:

      conda create -n B --clone A

      When having the path of A, you can also (I have not tried yet):

      conda create -n B --clone D:\A

    6. Enter an environment

      conda activate env_name

    7. Exist an environment

      deactivate env_name

    8. Remove a whole env

      conda remove -n your_env_name --all

    9. Delete a package

      conda remove --name $your_env_name  $package_name

    10. Set the mirror (to speed up download)

      a.Add the mirror

      conda config --add channels https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/anaconda/pkgs/free/

      b. Show the channel urls when searching

      conda config --set show_channel_urls yes

      c. Remove the settings you've made:

      conda config --remove-key channels

    11. Without setting a mirror, you could also add an url after the installation instruction everytime manually.

      pip install package_name -i https://pypi.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/simple/
    Doriså¤§çº¦ 1 åˆ†é’ŸCSComputer
    Git

    Self-learning link: https://nulab.com/zh-cn/learn/software-development/git-tutorial/

    Account & Connection

    1. Initialize your folder as the local repo
      git init
    2. Setting the mailbox
      git config --global user.email xxxx
    3. Display all the Git setting lists and their origins
      git config --list --show-origin
    4. Test the connection
      ssh -T git@github.com
    5. Change an interface
      git config --global http.proxy "http://127.0.0.1:8080"
